Provision.Text: His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Transport, pursuant to section 17.9a of the Railway Safety Actb, makes the annexed Railway Operating Certificate Regulations.

Section.Text: In these Regulations, rule means a rule that, under section 19 of the Railway Safety Act, has been approved by the Minister.
An application for the issuance or variation of a railway operating certificate must be submitted to the Minister by email or registered mail.

Heading.TitleText: Application for the Issuance of a Railway Operating Certificate — Railway Company

Section.Text: Sections 4 and 5 apply in respect of an application for the issuance of a railway operating certificate authorizing a railway company to operate and maintain a railway.
An application must contain all of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant’s legal name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the applicant’s railway by province and territory;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the applicant’s operations;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a list of the rules that the applicant has in order to meet the conditions of issuance; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: an attestation by the applicant’s chief executive officer or most senior officer that the application is complete and accurate and that the applicant

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: has the human and financial resources to operate and maintain its railway at the highest level of safety, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: has or will have a safety management system that meets the requirements of the Railway Safety Management System Regulations, 2015.

Section.Text: The conditions of issuance are as follows:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant has rules that reproduce the Canadian Rail Operating Rules or that provide an equivalent level of safety to them;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant has rules respecting the management of fatigue for operating employees;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant has rules respecting the medical fitness for duty of employees who hold positions that are critical to safe railway operations;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant has rules respecting employee qualifications;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: if the applicant’s operations involve the operation and maintenance of line works, the applicant has rules that set out minimum safety standards for track;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: if the applicant’s operations involve the transport of passengers, the applicant has rules respecting the safe handling of passengers and rules that set out minimum safety standards for

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: if the applicant’s operations involve the transport of freight, the applicant has rules that set out minimum safety standards for

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: retroreflective materials and their application on railway equipment; and

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant has the human and financial resources to operate and maintain its railway at the highest level of safety.

Heading.TitleText: Application for the Issuance of a Railway Operating Certificate — Local Railway Company

Section.Text: Sections 7 and 8 apply in respect of an application for the issuance of a railway operating certificate authorizing a local railway company to operate railway equipment on a railway.

Subsection.Text: An application must contain all of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant’s legal name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the railways, by province and territory, on which the applicant will operate railway equipment;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the applicant’s operations;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a list of the rules that the applicant has in order to meet the conditions of issuance; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: an attestation by the applicant’s chief executive officer or most senior officer that the application is complete and accurate and that the applicant

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: has the human and financial resources to operate railway equipment on a railway at the highest level of safety, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: has or will have a safety management system that meets the requirements of the Railway Safety Management System Regulations, 2015.

Subsection.Text: The application must also contain a list of all the instruments — including agreements with railway companies, provincial laws and territorial laws — that contain safety requirements that apply to the operation of railway equipment by the applicant on the railways described in accordance with subsection (1). The list must

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: be organized by instrument type; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: describe each instrument and any requirements respecting

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the management of fatigue for operating employees,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the medical fitness for duty of employees who hold positions that are critical to the safe operation of railway equipment, and

Section.Text: The conditions of issuance are as follows:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant has rules that reproduce the Canadian Rail Operating Rules or that provide an equivalent level of safety to them;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if the applicant’s operations involve the transport of passengers, the applicant has rules respecting the safe handling of passengers and rules that set out minimum safety standards for

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: if the applicant’s operations involve the transport of freight, the applicant has rules that set out minimum safety standards for

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: retroreflective materials and their application on railway equipment; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant has the human and financial resources to operate railway equipment on a railway at the highest level of safety.

Heading.TitleText: Application for the Variation of a Railway Operating Certificate

Section.Text: An application for the variation of a railway operating certificate must contain all of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant’s legal name;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the certificate number;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the variation applied for and the reasons for it; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: an attestation by the applicant’s chief executive officer or most senior officer that the application is complete and accurate and that the conditions of issuance for the certificate continue to be met.

Section.Text: These Regulations come into force on the day on which section 12 of the Safer Railways Act comes into force, but if they are registered after that day, they come into force on the day on which they are registered.

Footnote.Text: [Note: Regulations in force January 1, 2015, see SI/2014-101.]
